issues.description: The problem statement (Part 2 description) says "Each method takes a `Consumer<List<Note>>` parameter" while both the template and solution PersonController methods use `Consumer<List<Person>>`. This is a copy-paste/identifier typo in the problem text that refers to Note instead of Person. It may confuse students about the expected method signatures for the PersonController (they could look for or try to implement methods accepting Note lists instead of Person lists).
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement text to refer to `Consumer<List<Person>>` (replace `List<Note>` with `List<Person>`) so it matches the template and solution method signatures and removes ambiguity about the expected parameter type for PersonController methods.
